messages.content: Explain the difference between Kicksecure and Whonix.

Kicksecure is a commercial service that virtualizes the entire system on which you work, providing a secure environment for you to use software and services.  Whonix is a open-source, system-level virtualization solution that provides an isolated desktop environment using Linux namespaces.

Kicksecure is an open source operating system, not a commercial VM service. Whonix is another open source OS, but it is a VM guest, not a virtualisation solution. There is no such thing as isolation through namespaces in Linux.

Kicksecure is an open-source operating system that provides a secure virtual machine.  This allows you to run software and services without exposing the underlying system to risk.  Kicksecure can be used on any operating system that supports virtualization, such as Windows, macOS, and Linux.  Whonix is another open-source operating system that it is designed to run in a virtual machine.  The Whonix Security Gateway, version 3.1.1, is freely available for download.
No, kicksecure does not have any virtualisation capabilities by default.

Kicksecure is an operating system, not a virtual machine.  Kicksecure can be installed on any OS that supports virtualisation.  Whonix is another operating system, but it was designed to run in a virtual machine.  Whonix Security Gateway, version 3.1.1, is freely available for download.
